article:
Events and trends
* 739 BCâHiram II succeeds Ithobaal II as king of Tyre.
* 738 BCâKing Tiglath-Pileser III of Assyria invades Israel, forcing it to
  pay tribute.
* 738 BCâThe Biskupin settlement northeast of Poznan (Poland) is built.
* 737 and 736 BCâKing Tiglath-Pileser III of Assyria invades Iran, conquering
  the Medes and Persians and slaughtering, enslaving or deporting
  many.
* 735 BCâNaxos in Sicily founded as a colony of Chalcis in Euboea.
  (traditional date)
* 734 BCâSyracuse founded in Sicily as a joint colony of Corinth and Tenea,
  under the leadership of Archias of Corinth.
* 732 BCâKing Tiglath-Pileser III of Assyria seizes Damascus, executes Rezin,
  King of the Arameans, and deports the Aramaean inhabitants to Kir of
  Moab. [[2 Kings]] 16:9. (probable date)
* 732 BCâHoshea becomes the last king of Israel.
* 730 BCâNorthern Egypt ceases to be ruled by Libyan pharaohs.
* 730 BCâOsorkon IV succeeds Pedubast II as king of the Twenty-second Dynasty of
  Egypt. (approximate date)
* 730 BCâPiye succeeds his father, Kashta, as king of the Nubian kingdom
  of Napata.
* 730 BCâMattan II succeeds Hiram II as king of Tyre.
* 730 BCâLeontini in Sicily is founded by colonists from Naxos.

Significant people
* Homer, 730 BC
